intro: Cromidon corrigioloides, commonly known as the common rock cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers. It has alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cromidon corrigioloides is often found in alpine or arctic regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
